channel.title: Particle editing
channel.description:
I know what do you think about the title, again another noob who can't add the "-tools" to the Ep2 startup commands. No! I will not ask about using the OB Particle Editor, but I will ask about editing it with hands!
There was a video, what showed us as one of the dev's is using their own version of the Particle Editor. It was a lot better looking (I think) than the current official one, but I still don't want to ask for it (but if it was released, please tell me :smiley: ). I would like to ask about the file specification. How to edit existing particles, how to create new ones from scratch, but the best would be a library what can read, write, and update PCF files (and as I'm a C# developer, it would be the best in C# :smiley: ).
So, anyone got info about it?

item.title: Particle editing
item.dc:creator: fonix232
item.description:
I know what do you think about the title, again another noob who can’t add the “-tools” to the Ep2 startup commands. No! I will not ask about using the OB Particle Editor, but I will ask about editing it with hands!

There was a video, what showed us as one of the dev’s is using their own version of the Particle Editor. It was a lot better looking (I think) than the current official one, but I still don’t want to ask for it (but if it was released, please tell me ). I would like to ask about the file specification. How to edit existing particles, how to create new ones from scratch, but the best would be a library what can read, write, and update PCF files (and as I’m a C# developer, it would be the best in C# ).

So, anyone got info about it?

Read full topic
